File libsrc/libstring/string.c

Utility routines for character strings.

Public Functions

stringCleanPath 
 char *stringCleanPath(char *path)
Remove extra directory separators from a file path. Remove "/../" or "/./" from a path name (like realpath on SUN).

Parameters:
path - The file path to be modified.
Returns:
path
stringCopy 
 char *stringCopy(const char *s)
Create a copy of a string. Return a pointer to allocated memory that contains a copy of the input string.

Parameters:
s - The character string to be copied.
Returns:
A pointer to the copied string. Free it after use. Returns NULL, if the memory allocation failed.
stringcpy 
 char *stringcpy(char *dest,
                 const char *src,
                 int n)
stringEndsWith 
 int stringEndsWith(const char *s,
                    const char *ending)
Check for a string ending.

Parameters:
s - The input string.
ending - A substring to compare to the ending of s.
Returns:
1 if the end of s matches the ending. Returns 0 if it does not match.
stringGetArg 
 char *stringGetArg(const char *str,
                    const char *name)
Return the string parameter value. Search the input string for the first occurrence of name=value and return value. should be freed after use.

Parameters:
str - The input string to search.
name - The parameter name.
Returns:
The string value, or NULL if name is not found. The returned pointer
stringGetArgv 
 char *stringGetArgv(int argc,
                     const char **argv,
                     const char *name)
Seach program arguments for a parameter string value. Returns the last occurrence of the string value for name=value.

Parameters:
argc - The number of strings in argv.
argv - An array of strings to search for name=value.
name - The parameter name.
Returns:
The string value or NULL if name is not found. Free the returned pointer after use.
stringGetBoolArg 
 int stringGetBoolArg(const char *str,
                      const char *name,
                      int *value)
Return the boolean parameter value. Search the input string for the first occurrence of name=value and return value as a boolean (0 or 1).

Parameters:
str - The input string to search.
name - The parameter name.
Returns:
0 for success, -1 if the name was not found, -2 if name was found but the value is not a long.

See Also:
stringToBool
stringGetBoolArgv 
 int stringGetBoolArgv(int argc,
                       const char **argv,
                       const char *name,
                       int *value)
Seach program arguments for a parameter boolean value. Returns the last occurrence of the boolean value for name=value.

Parameters:
argc - The number of strings in argv.
argv - An array of strings to search for name=value.
name - The parameter name.
value - The boolean value found.
Returns:
1 if name was found and the value could be converted to a boolean. Returns 0 otherwise.

See Also:
stringToBool
stringGetDir 
 int stringGetDir(const char *filename)
Return the string directory as a quark. The directory is all characters before the last '/'. Return a quark representation of a zero length string (""), if the input string does not contain a '/'.

Parameters:
filename - The input string.
Returns:
A quark representation of the prefix.
stringGetDoubleArg 
 int stringGetDoubleArg(const char *str,
                        const char *name,
                        double *value)
Return the double parameter value. Search the input string for the first occurrence of name=value and return value as a double.

Parameters:
str - The input string to search.
name - The parameter name.
Returns:
0 for success, -1 if the name was not found, -2 if name was found but the value is not a double.
stringGetDoubleArgv 
 int stringGetDoubleArgv(int argc,
                         const char **argv,
                         const char *name,
                         double *value)
Seach program arguments for a parameter int value. Returns the last occurrence of the int value for name=value.

Parameters:
argc - The number of strings in argv.
argv - An array of strings to search for name=value.
name - The parameter name.
value - The int value found.
Returns:
1 if name was found and the value could be converted to a double. Returns 0 otherwise.

See Also:
stringToDouble
stringGetIntArg 
 int stringGetIntArg(const char *str,
                     const char *name,
                     int *value)
Return the int parameter value. Search the input string for the first occurrence of name=value and return value as an int.

Parameters:
str - The input string to search.
name - The parameter name.
Returns:
0 for success, -1 if the name was not found, -2 if name was found but the value is not an integer.
stringGetIntArgv 
 int stringGetIntArgv(int argc,
                      const char **argv,
                      const char *name,
                      int *value)
Seach program arguments for a parameter int value. Returns the last occurrence of the int value for name=value.

Parameters:
argc - The number of strings in argv.
argv - An array of strings to search for name=value.
name - The parameter name.
value - The int value found.
Returns:
1 if name was found and the value could be converted to a int. Returns 0 otherwise.

See Also:
stringToInt
stringGetLine 
 int stringGetLine(FILE *fp,
                   char *line,
                   int n)
Read the next line. Read up to n characters of the next line of input. Characters beyond n are ignored and will be skipped by a subsequent call.

Parameters:
fp - The FILE pointer of an open file.
line - A character string of length >= n+1 to receive the line.
n - The maximum number of characters to read.
Returns:
0 for success, EOF for end-of-file.
stringGetLongArg 
 int stringGetLongArg(const char *str,
                      const char *name,
                      long *value)
Return the long parameter value. Search the input string for the first occurrence of name=value and return value as a long.

Parameters:
str - The input string to search.
name - The parameter name.
Returns:
0 for success, -1 if the name was not found, -2 if name was found but the value is not a long.
stringGetLongArgv 
 int stringGetLongArgv(int argc,
                       const char **argv,
                       const char *name,
                       long *value)
Seach program arguments for a parameter long value. Returns the last occurrence of the long value for name=value.

Parameters:
argc - The number of strings in argv.
argv - An array of strings to search for name=value.
name - The parameter name.
value - The long value found.
Returns:
1 if name was found and the value could be converted to a long. Returns 0 otherwise.

See Also:
stringToLong
stringGetPrefix 
 int stringGetPrefix(const char *filename)
Return the string prefix as a quark. The prefix is all characters before the last period '.'. Return a quark representation of the entire input string, if it does not contain a period.

Parameters:
filename - The input string.
Returns:
A quark representation of the prefix.
stringGetSuffix 
 int stringGetSuffix(const char *filename)
Return the string suffix as a quark. The suffix is all characters after the last period '.'. Return a quark representation of a zero length string (""), if the input string does not contain a period.

Parameters:
filename - The input string.
Returns:
A quark representation of the suffix.
stringReplace 
 char *stringReplace(char *str,
                     const char *old_pattern,
                     const char *new_pattern)
Replace a pattern. In the string str, replace all occurrences of old_pattern with new_pattern. The length of new_pattern should be <= the length of old_pattern. If the length of new_pattern is greater than the length of old_pattern, only characters in new_pattern up to the smaller length will be used.

Parameters:
str - The character string that will be modified.
old_pattern - The substring that will be replaced in str.
new_pattern - The replacement substring.
Returns:
str
stringSuffix 
 const char *stringSuffix(const char *filename)
Return the string suffix. The suffix is all characters after the last period '.'. Return NULL if the input string does not contain a period.

Parameters:
filename - The input string.
Returns:
Pointer to the suffix or NULL.
stringToBool 
 int stringToBool(const char *text,
                  int *b)
Convert a string to boolean (0 or 1). If the string is (ignoring case) "t", "true", "1", "f", "false", or "0", the conversion is successful. Otherwise not. Set *b to 1 if text is "t", "true" or "1". Set *b to 0 if text is "f", "false", or "0". Case is ignored.

Parameters:
text - The input string.
b - Set to 0 or 1, if the conversion is successful.
Returns:
1 if the conversion is successful, 0 otherwise.
stringToDouble 
 int stringToDouble(const char *text,
                    double *d)
Convert a string to a double.

Parameters:
text - The input string.
d - Set to the double value.
Returns:
1 if the conversion is successful, 0 otherwise.
stringToInt 
 int stringToInt(const char *text,
                 int *i)
Convert a string to a int.

Parameters:
text - The input string.
i - Set to the int value.
Returns:
1 if the conversion is successful, 0 otherwise.
stringToLong 
 int stringToLong(const char *text,
                  long *l)
Convert a string to a long.

Parameters:
text - The input string.
l - Set to the long value.
Returns:
1 if the conversion is successful, 0 otherwise.
stringToLower 
 char *stringToLower(char *str)
Convert all upper case characters to lower case.

Parameters:
str - A null terminated string. All upper case characters in str are be converted to lower case.
Returns:
str
stringToShort 
 int stringToShort(const char *text,
                   short *s)
Convert a string to a short.

Parameters:
text - The input string.
s - Set to the long value.
Returns:
1 if the conversion is successful, 0 otherwise.
stringToUpper 
 char *stringToUpper(char *str)
Convert all lower case characters to upper case.

Parameters:
str - A null terminated string. All lower case characters in str are be converted to upper case.
Returns:
str
stringTrim 
 char *stringTrim(char *str)
Remove white space before and after the text. Remove all white-space characters from the beginning and from the end of the input string. The non-white-space characters are shifted to the beginning of the string. White-spaces are space, form-feed ('\f'), newline ('\n'), carriage return ('\r'), horizontal tab ('\t'), and vertical tab ('\v').

Parameters:
str - The character string to be modified.
Returns:
str
stringTrimCopy 
 char *stringTrimCopy(char *a,
                      const char *b,
                      int n)
Copy b to a, skipping spaces at the beginning and end of the string b.

Parameters:
a - String of length >= n (included '\0') that will receive characters from b.
b - The string to copy.
n - The number of non-white-space characters to copy from b to a.
stringTrimToQuark 
 int stringTrimToQuark(const char *a)
Trim and convert a string to a quark (int).

Parameters:
a - The character string.
Returns:
The quark value.
